comments.body: Yeah there could be a crusher block, kind of like the stonecutter's bench
Narratively it wouldn't make sense and sand/cobblestone + gravel and sand have both been in the game for what seems like forever. I don't think they would ever do it TBH.
Why would you want something to be crushed into the worst block in the game? Who actually likes gravel?

Gravel is used in creating concrete. And when you need a lot of it, running around the world to collect it is not the most joyful event. A lot of cobblestones. This offer is not a cheat, in reality, gravel, or rather its industrial counterpart - rubble (or macadam), is obtained from cobblestones and boulders.
this is would allow for sand & gravel farms!!!
Definitely agree. I have a cool faux window design but the flapping kills the immersion. I will have to wait for the banner to age, I've heard, if I want it to stop.
What would you use luck potions for? I wasn't aware it was in the game is it in java or bedrock or both?

Probably it would help get more ores like with fortune tools and for mob drops looting swords, it could really help you a lot. It could also give you lower and better trades from villagers. And even special stuff you can’t get by trading villagers.

 

Plus I think the potion effect will be green or gold with a lucky clover on it.

I think they should get clovers into Minecraft (lucky and normal)

Basically another way to get access to that potion.
And get them rarely from chests

That would be handy. Especially if you're trying to escape mobs or have a treehouse.
They could add bananas too. You could get bananas and use them to tame monkeys and then the monkey could bring you back presents, similar to a cat but things only from trees. Like a stick or apple or a block or leaves.

Why do we have to kill the monkey? The game promotes animal slaughter enough already, perhaps a better way of getting the potion or it's ingredients would be from the jungle temple, feeding a monkey fruit would cause it to lead you to a temple, the temple would also be made harder and have more variation. The potion would also let you jump higher and with more power from leaves, logs and vines that are part of a living tree as-well as climb vines faster.
not just one but more like tree-like trees in the end so we can explore more
Cool idea the ore sounds cool but I think that there should be chances to get that ore when you break it

Instead of just making campfires stackable, why not make everything stackable and with things like weapons, that are stacked when one runs out of durability it comes up with a message saying “your ‘item’ has run out of durability. Would you like to use the next one in your stack? Y/N
I definitely think this would be helpful for things like building where it's annoying that you can only hold one in each slot, which makes bedrock players shy away from using them.
perfect
It would also work as a saddle (there's a saddle in the recipe so why not?)
If this is the mounts and madness or something update than we need MOUNT UPDATES not just netherite horse armor and a water mount.
Would the area of ink stun/confuse mobs?
I presume it would just give them a strong blindness effect, so they can't see anything for a short while.
U should see the suggestion below yours. And try the search bar.
That would be cool. Make it so when you hold it you have fire resistance so you can swim (properly swim) in lava
This can be done to an extent my playing around with the debug stick and wall blocks, but this sort of glitchy behavior should not have to be relied upon.

During the Cave and Cliffs update the way structure voids interact with walls and fences etc. was take out. Im not sure if it is a bug or deliberate but it completely messed up many peoples way of building and adding detail to their builds. Can you please do whatever you can to add this function of the structure void back in and if not add some sort of debug stick for the bedrock version as soon as possible. Another quick bug that hasn’t been fixed since Caves and Cliffs part 1 is that banners show through the texture of transparent blocks.
Yeah. This issue needs to be resolved

Maybe they could be added to diamond tools/armor and have the same strength as netherite?

Also they could be not fire proof and maybe they would work more like keep inventory, so you wouldn't get saved from the void, you would just keep the tools/armor

I like this idea, with a few tweaks.

Similar to Netherite, you would need to find multiple pieces to combine with another material to form the Enderite Ingots. This other material could be found in the Deep Dark, to encourage exploration as well as making it more challenging to achieve. The Enderite Ingot would upgrade Netherite tools and armor. When Netherite armor is upgraded, it would lose its Knockback Resistance, and instead can have Fall Damage Resistance.
How would it work.
This shouldn’t be a crafting table but instead a software for easy mod/add-on making.
Thats an awesome design!
Luv it!

Just like gold armor, it's going to be something you'll just take off once there's no need to keep it on.

The whole armor set has the weakness of leather armor, and needs two pieces to do what a single jack o'lantern does.
it should be made with a smithing table sortof like netherite
Carved pumpkin works in similar way. Plus, if Mojang decide to add wooden armour, they would probably end up with armour of other wood types. Kinda pointless.
Endermen are pretty easy to avoid, so adding an armor to make them not attack you would be pointless. No one would wear the armor.
That would be fun to build with.
What would be used to craft it.
Can you try to give more info on what it is?

How would it be moveable? As in if I bump into it, it slides? Because I think it would have to be an entity then.

I would love for there to be crates too, and there is a thread about crates showing the foods inside. Here's a link. It's not my suggestion, but please vote! Imagine all the market stalls, feasts, and pantries you could make!

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360032698572-Additional-Storage-Blocks-
Sounds good, but it would remove some of the shulker box functionality. I have to say no, unless they are reasonably expensive.

The thing about storage blocks is that they all have different properties to make the unique. For example chest's can double up by placing one next to another, ender chests, have a storage you can access anywhere, with another ender chest. The barrel you can have a block on top of it and you would still be able to open and then the shulker box, where you can break it while keeping the stuff inside. The idea you offered would just be weaker shulker box with nothing unique besides the only one item in the crate. Sure, it could be used as a decoration block, in fact I like that idea, but it would be a useless storage block. How about you have to break it to get the things out of it? Like you could put cobblestone in it, and if you need blocks you could break it? It should have a unique aspect is what I am saying. I like the decoration idea a lot though.

I like where you are going, it’s just that the crate has nothing special about it. It’s basically a barrel with no UI. Maybe it could have the properties of a double chest, able to be opened without space above it, AND be able to be dyed like a shulker box? If so, go team CRATE!
We have chests, ender chests, barrels. What more do we need?
Good point.

Early game shulker box. Excellent. The game needs an inventory overall for the early-mid game. Four wood planks and iron ingots in the corners, more expensive than a chest or barrel. Make a it little smaller to nerf it, say it only has 15 slots, and only holds one item. Alternatively, make it 27 slots like a chest (still one item type) but give it durability; every time you open it loses durability till it breaks and all your items pop out. Items entering it from a hopper should not reduce durability though. Best designed to pack bulk storage.
Oddly, height doesn't change how much you can see, as it doesn't effect render distance.
Thanks PlutonicPoet34, I hadn't taken that into account until you mentioned It! I have edited the post accordingly.

Make way more free maps

Please
I thought of this idea as well i was thinking it would be made with a shield in the center and arrows around it, for an actual crafting thing. and you could add it with poisoned arrows
The spike shield Enchantment also has spikes on the shield
I thought that a shield and gunpowder around it
I would rather a sweetberry pie, similar to the pumpkin pie
I think you should craft a cake and then surround it with sweet berries and it be placed and last longer than a normal cake
I love this idea
I do n’t think Rana Boots can make people jump higher, but I think it can prevent people from falling into the snow.
YEAH
What if netherrack could be burnt but it ran out after like 1/4 of an item
blaze rods and coal are available in the nether
Yup, thats a good idea, so PLEASE Mojang add some fuel on the Nether, so very hard finding fuel in the Nether
lava buckets are fuel
What do you think of magma as fuel? It could smelt 1/5 to 1/3 as many items as a lava bucket. Possibly producing a cobblestone after it is activated as fuel.
There already is fuel in the nether. Its lava and it smelts 100 items per bucket
It could be hard to craft, but very bright. Or possibly only attainable through creative, chests, and/or commands (for use by mapmakers and as a neat reward).
Maybe an item dropped from the glow squid could be used to craft this item

This item could be able to weaken the mobs that burn in the day.
Maybe make them slower or do less damage

Alloy age

Different alloy ratios or temperatures will have different textures and strengths.
Such as iron-carbon alloys, there are many types.

I agree with everything except the iron & steel looks: steel should be darker than iron because of higher carbon content. The Netherite Block's texture is so simple too, so its texture should really be given to a Block of Steel and the netherite be changed to something more lustrous and like a trophy, worthy of the painstaking effort it actually takes to make one.

Following from @GONG BO-LIN, there should be a system for alloy ratios if this blast furnace idea is to be fully fleshed-out. Perhaps a grid-like system or just placing the items in and a ratio appearing in a dialogue box, showing for each item put in. For example:   6 iron ingots, 2 coal, 1 gold ingot shows up as 6 : 2 : 1 with the corresponding items below each number. This to me seems an intuitive way to introduce players to a complex alloy-forging system.

Sorry, I mean that alloy systems need not only ratios, but also temperature control and time, just like the four processes of heat treatment in engineering materials (normalizing, continuous, tempering, quenching)
Each process is treated differently. Even if the ratio is the same, the division of the elements will be different, which will lead to different properties of the alloy.
 
Therefore, I think that this alloy system has processing method options in addition to proportions, so it includes heat treatment (normalizing, continuous, tempering and quenching), and the value of the tool will change less. Perhaps an exclusive enchanting method of turning heat treatment into a tool is also a way of thinking.
I think it should be simple and more like crafting with fuel and metals
This is a fantastic idea.
Perhaps 'hardened netherrack' could be added that looks like a dark purple stone with lava cracks cracking though?
Would this work like bonemeal, or would it be crafted into the farmland to make the farmland more fertile?
bamboo be useful in composter you mean?
